TEXT.English: [TAB]Scholars debate what exactly constitutes an Empire (from the Latin "imperium", denoting military command within the ancient Roman government). Generally, they may define an empire as a state that extends dominion over areas and populations distinct culturally and ethnically from the culture/ethnicity at the center of power. There are, however, many types of definitions, including definitions based on economic factors and those based on political factors. The term is most commonly understood to mean that of the military hegemonic power.

TEXT.English: [TAB]During the Islamic Golden Age, early forms of proto-capitalism and free markets were present in the Caliphate, where an early market economy and an early form of mercantilism were developed between the 8th-12th centuries, which some refer to as "Islamic capitalism". A vigorous monetary economy was created on the basis of the expanding levels of circulation of a stable, high-value currency (the dinar) and the integration of monetary areas that were previously independent.[PARAGRAPH:2]A number of economic concepts and techniques were applied in early Islamic banking, including bills of exchange, the first forms of partnership (mufawada) such as limited partnerships (mudaraba), and the earliest forms of capital (al-mal), capital accumulation (nama al-mal), cheques, promissory notes, trusts (waqf), transactional accounts, loaning, ledgers and assignments. Organizational enterprises independent from the state also existed in the medieval Islamic world, while the agency institution was also introduced during that time. Many of these early capitalist concepts were adopted and further advanced in medieval Europe from the 13th century onwards.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In some religions, law can be thought of as the ordering principle of reality; knowledge as revealed by a God defining and governing all human affairs. Law, in the religious sense, also includes codes of ethics and morality which are upheld and required by the God. Examples include customary Halakha (Jewish law) and Hindu law, and to an extent, Sharia (Islamic law) and Canon law (Christian law).

TEXT.English: [TAB]An Oligarchy is a form of government where political power effectively rests with a small elite segment of society distinguished by royalty, wealth, family, military powers or occult spiritual hegemony. The word oligarchy is from the Greek words for "few" and "rule." Such states are often controlled by politically powerful families whose children were heavily conditioned and mentored to be heirs of the power of the oligarchy. This type of power by its very nature may not be exercised openly; the oligarchs preferring to remain "the power behind the throne", exerting control through economic means. Oligarchies have been tyrannical throughout history, being completely reliant on public servitude to exist. Although Aristotle pioneered the use of the term as a synonym for rule by the rich, for which the exact term is plutocracy, oligarchy is not always a rule by wealth, as oligarchs can simply be a privileged group.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une oligarchie - du grec oligos (peu nombreux) et arkh\EA (commandement) - est une forme de gouvernement par une classe dominante peu nombreuse qui s'est coopt\E9e elle-m\EAme selon des crit\E8res mal d\E9finis. Sa l\E9gitimit\E9 n'est pas fond\E9e sur celle des autres types de r\E9gime: ni d'\EAtre les meilleurs (aristocratie), ni les plus riches (ploutocratie), ni les plus populaires (d\E9mocratie), ni la plus comp\E9tente (technocratie), ni non plus le tirage au sort, la force ou l'h\E9r\E9dit\E9, mais d'exercer un pouvoir de fait, en s'appuyant parfois sur un ou plusieurs des crit\E8res de l\E9gitimit\E9 qui caract\E9risent les autres r\E9gimes. Le terme oligarque, qui n'\E9tait plus utilis\E9 que pour l'histoire des soci\E9t\E9s anciennes ou les r\E9cits de science fiction, a trouv\E9 un regain de faveur pour d\E9signer les hommes d'affaire riches ayant des liens avec le pouvoir politique qui ont \E9merg\E9 en Russie apr\E8s la d\E9sint\E9gration de la bureaucratie du r\E9gime sovi\E9tique.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Oligarchie (vom griech.: oligarchia "Herrschaft Weniger", zusammengesetzt aus oligoi "Wenige" und arche "Herrschaft") ist in der klassischen (antiken) Verfassungslehre die Entartung der Aristokratie. Zur Abgrenzung von dieser Bedeutung und in Besinnung auf den eigentlichen Wortsinn wird heute auch der an sich gleichbedeutende Begriff Oligokratie (krat\EDa = Macht, Herrschaft, Kraft, St\E4rke) verwendet. Die Oligarchie bei Platon (427-347 v. Chr.) ist die gesetzlose Herrschaft der Reichen, die nur an ihrem Eigennutz interessiert sind. Sie f\E4llt wie die Aristokratie unter die Herrschaft der Wenigen, wobei die Aristokratie als gesetzm\E4\DFige, am Gemeinwohl ausgerichtete Herrschaft gilt. Diese Idee wurde zun\E4chst von seinem Sch\FCler Aristoteles (384-324 v. Chr.), und sp\E4ter vom griechischen Historiker Polybios (um 200 v. Chr. - etwa 118 v. Chr.) weiterentwickelt. Grunds\E4tzlich bestand in der antiken Staatstheorie seit Platon die Idee, dass jede am Gemeinwohl orientierte Herrschaftsform (Monarchie (auch: Basileia), Aristokratie, Demokratie) ein entartetes, nur an den Interessen der Herrschenden orientiertes Gegenst\FCck hat (Tyrannis, Oligarchie, Ochlokratie). Aus der Erkenntnis heraus, dass diese sechs Grundformen der Verfassungen notwendigerweise instabil sind, hat vor allem Polybios die Idee des Verfassungskreislaufs entwickelt, die diese Herrschaftsformen zueinander in Beziehung setzt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'oligarchia (dal greco "oligoi" (pochi e "arch\E8" (potere, comando) \E8 il sistema di governo di una minoranza, di un gruppo ristretto di persone ed \E8 anche detto Governo di Pochi. Nell'antica Grecia il termine oligarchia indicava principalmente il governo di una classe scelta in base al censo, invece che alla nascita, requisito essenziale del governo di matrice aristocratica. Nell'Atene del V secolo a.C. vi furono il governo oligarchico dei "Quattrocento" nel 411 a.C. ed il regime dei Trenta tiranni del 404 a.C. Nella tradizione del pensiero filosofico greco, sistematizzata da Aristotele (vedi principio aristotelico) l'oligarchia \E8 una forma di governo "cattiva", non perch\E9 antidemocratica, ma perch\E9 quei pochi esercitano il potere indebitamente, o in quanto non ne hanno il diritto o in quanto lo fanno violando le leggi o, infine, in quanto lo esercitano favorendo gli interessi particolaristici a scapito di quelli della comunit\E0. Se, invece, i pochi che esercitano un potere lo fanno in maniera legittima e in vista dell'interesse generale, allora il loro governo \E8 quello dei migliori, e cio\E8 un'aristocrazia. Secondo Aristotele l'oligarchia \E8 dunque la degenerazione dell'aristocrazia. Nella tradizione del pensiero occidentale si \E8 conservata a lungo, dall'antichit\E0 al Medioevo, il concetto che un governo di pochi non \E8 cattivo in s\E9 ma solo in quanto i pochi governino male. Nell'et\E0 moderna invece si \E8 progressivamente affermata la concezione democratica e, con essa, la tesi che un governo di pochi \E8, in quanto tale, un cattivo governo: un governo buono \E8 quello in cui \E8 la maggioranza (i pi\F9) che governa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La oligarqu\EDa, en ciencia pol\EDtica, es una forma de gobierno en la que el poder supremo est\E1 en manos de unas pocas personas. Los escritores pol\EDticos de la antigua Grecia emplearon el t\E9rmino para designar la forma degenerada y negativa de aristocracia (literalmente, gobierno de los mejores). Estrictamente, la oligarqu\EDa surgir\E1 cuando la sucesi\F3n de un sistema aristocr\E1tico se perpet\FAe por transferencia sangu\EDnea o m\EDtica, sin que las cualidades \E9ticas y de direcci\F3n de los mejores surjan como m\E9rito reconocido por la comunidad, siendo esta definici\F3n muy cercana a la de monarqu\EDa y m\E1s todav\EDa a la de nobleza. Los oligarcas due\F1os de propiedades, de tierras o de grandes acumulaciones de dinero, son poseedores de fuerza en la direcci\F3n pol\EDtica gracias a sus fuertes influencias econ\F3micas. Poseen est\E1ndares \E9ticos posiblemente dudosos, con diversos medios de legitimaci\F3n, que tienen como piso el poder acumulado y el s\EDmbolo hist\F3rico que haya significado la sucesi\F3n que les dio fuerza. La oligarqu\EDa es un grupo minoritario de personas, pertenecientes a una misma clase social, generalmente con gran poder e influencia (aristocr\E1tica) que dirige y controla una colectividad o instituci\F3n.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Meritocracy is a system of a government or other organization wherein appointments are made and responsibilities assigned to individuals based upon demonstrated talent and ability (merit). In a meritocracy, society rewards (via wealth, position, and social status) those who show talent and competence as demonstrated by past actions or by competition. [PARAGRAPH:2]Meritocracy was the primary basis for selection of chiefs and generals in the Mongol Empire. Genghis Khan chose whomever was talented and fit for his military chain of command. He even trusted generals and soldiers from opponents' armies if they showed loyalty to their leaders. For example, Genghis Khan's general Jebe had been an enemy soldier who had shot Genghis in battle before he became Great Khan.

For example, Genghis Khan's general Jebe had been an enemy soldier who had shot Genghis in battle before he became Great Khan.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Great institutions of learning passed knowledge to eager scholars in ages past. Sages and pupils are too much of an economic drain to sustain in these harsh times, but that doesn't mean education is neglected. The blacksmith and the butcher both need an intellectual heir, and a system of apprenticeship is the surest way to insure one.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans le passé, de grandes institutions éducatives ont transmis leur savoir à de fervents érudits. Sages et élèves sont bien trop coûteux pour que la société puisse subvenir à leurs besoins en ces temps difficiles, mais cela ne veut pas dire que l'éducation est négligée. Le forgeron et le boucher ont tous deux besoin de perpétuer leurs connaissances et l'apprentissage est le meilleur moyen de les transmettre.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Große Institutionen des Lernens gaben in der Vergangenheit das Wissen an eifrige Schüler weiter. Weise und ihre Schüler sind eine zu große wirtschaftliche Belastung in schweren Zeiten wie diesen, doch das heißt nicht, dass die Ausbildung vernachlässigt wird. Der Schmied und der Metzger brauchen beide intelligente Nachfolger, und ein Ausbildungssystem ist der beste Weg, für solche zu sorgen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le grandi istituzioni scolastiche tramandavano la conoscenza ad avidi studenti, nelle ere passate. Saggi e scolari rappresentano un costo troppo alto in questi tempi duri, ma non vuol dire che l'educazione sia trascurata. Fabbro e macellaio hanno bisogno di eredi e l'apprendistato è il miglior sistema per assicurarne uno a ciascuno.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En las eras pasadas, el conocimiento se transmitía por medio de grandes instituciones educativas. En estos tiempos, la existencia de sabios y pupilos representa un lujo que las empobrecidas sociedades no pueden permitirse, pero eso no quiere decir que se descuide la educación. Tanto el herrero como el carnicero necesitan herederos intelectuales, y el mejor modo de garantizarlos es instituir un sistema de aprendizaje.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Historically, the major juristic schools of Islam traditionally accepted the institution of slavery. Muhammad and many of his companions bought, sold, freed, and captured slaves. In Islamic law the topic of slavery is covered at great length. The Qur'an and the hadith see slavery as an exceptional condition that can be entered into under certain limited circumstances. Only children of slaves or non-Muslim prisoners of war could become slaves, never a freeborn Muslim. They also consider manumission of a slave to be one of many meritorious deeds available for the expiation of sins. According to Sharia, slaves are considered human beings and possessed of some rights on the basis of their humanity.[PARAGRAPH:2]In practice, slaves played various social and economic roles from Emir to worker. Slaves were widely employed in irrigation, mining, pastoralism and the army. Even some rulers relied on military and administrative slaves to such a degree that they seized power. However, people do not always treat with slaves in accordance with Islamic law. In some cases, the situation has been so harsh as to have led to uprisings such as Zanj Rebellion. However, this was usually the exception rather than the norm, as the vast majority of labour in the medieval Islamic world consisted of free, paid labour. For a variety of reasons, internal growth of the slave population was not enough to fulfill the demand in Muslim society. This resulted in massive importation, which involved enormous suffering and loss of life from the capture and transportation of slaves from non-Muslim lands. In theory, slavery in Islamic law does not have a racial or color component, although this has not always been the case in practice.

TEXT.French: Assujettissement
TEXT.Italian: Sottomissione
TEXT.Spanish: Subyugación

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "subjugation" is used to describe the policy of a nation's dominance over other lands. This doctrine has been frequently employed for economic exploitation in which an imperialist power makes use of other countries as sources of raw materials and cheap labor, shaping their economies to suit its own interests and keeping their people in poverty. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sometimes subjugation even refers to the acceptance, by the colonised, of the culture or doctrines of the coloniser as intrinsically more worthy or superior.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme d'Assujettissement fait référence à la politique de dominance d'une nation. Cette doctrine a souvent été employée pour l'exploitation économique d'un pays par un autre : un pouvoir impérialiste utilise d'autres pays en tant que sources de matières premières et de main-d'oeuvre bon marché, ajuste leur économie selon ses propres intérêts et maintient les gens dans la pauvreté. [PARAGRAPH:2]Parfois, l'Assujettissement fait référence à l'acceptation par les peuples colonisés de la culture ou des doctrines des colonisateurs, considérées comme meilleures ou supérieures.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Unterwerfung" beschreibt die politischen Bestrebungen einer Nation, andere Länder beherrschen zu wollen. Diese Doktrin wurde häufig zur Realisierung wirtschaftlicher Ausbeutung eingesetzt, wobei die Kolonialmacht andere Länder als Quellen für seltene Rohstoffe und billige Arbeitskräfte missbrauchte, deren Wirtschaft sie dann so gestaltete, dass sie zu den eigenen Interessen passte und schlussendlich die Einheimischen in ihrer Armut beließ. [PARAGRAPH:2]Manchmal wird mit "Unterwerfung" allerdings auch der Umstand bezeichnet, dass die Kolonisierten die Kultur oder Lehren der Kolonialmacht als "wertvoller" oder "besser" akzeptieren und würdigen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il termine "sottomissione" viene usato per descrivere il dominio di una nazione su altre terre. Questa dottrina è stata spesso usata per lo sfruttamento economico: una potenza imperialista sfrutta altri paesi come fonti di materie prime e lavoro a basso costo, modellando le loro economie a favore dei propri interessei e mantenendone le popolazioni in povertà. [PARAGRAPH:2]Alle volte la sottomissione fa addirittura riferimento all'accettazione, da parte dei colonizzati, di una presunta e intrinseca superiorità della cultura dei colonizzatori.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El término "subyugación" se utiliza para describir la política de dominio de una nación sobre otros territorios. Esta doctrina se ha empleado frecuentemente para describir la explotación económica que realiza una potencia imperialista cuando utiliza a otros países como fuentes de materias primas y mano de obra barata, modelando sus economías según sus propios intereses y manteniendo a sus gentes en la pobreza. [PARAGRAPH:2]A veces la subyugación también alude a la aceptación por parte de la colonia de la cultura o las doctrinas de la potencia colonial como intrínsecamente superiores.

TEXT.French: Vice-royauté
TEXT.Italian: Vicereame
TEXT.Spanish: Virreinato

TEXT.English: [TAB]A viceroy is a royal official who governs a country or province in the name of and as representative of a monarch. The term derives from the Latin prefix vice-, meaning "in the place of" and French roi, meaning king. His province or territory is called a viceroyalty. [PARAGRAPH:2]The title was originally used by the Aragonese Crown during the 14th Century to refer to Sardinia and Corsica. The absolutist Kings of Spain employed numerous Viceroys to rule over various parts of their vast empire "where the sun never sets", both European and overseas.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un vice-roi est un représentant royal qui gouverne un pays ou une province en tant que représentant d'un monarque. Il s'agit de la personne qui agit "à la place de" ("vice-") son roi. Sa province ou son territoire est appelée vice-royauté. [PARAGRAPH:2]Ce titre était utilisé à l'origine par la Couronne d'Aragon, durant le 14e siècle, pour désigner la Sardaigne et la Corse. Les monarques espagnols nommaient de nombreux vice-rois, afin de régner sur les différentes régions de leur vaste empire, "où le soleil ne se couche jamais", en Europe et par-delà les océans.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Vizekönig ist ein königlicher Würdenträger, der ein Land oder eine Provinz im Namen bzw. als Repräsentant des Königs regiert. Der Begriff ist von der lateinischen Vorsilbe "Vize" (an Stelle von) abgeleitet. Seine Provinz bzw. seine Ländereien werden Vizekönigreich genannt. [PARAGRAPH:2]Ursprünglich wurde dieser Titel seit dem 14. Jahrhundert vom Aragonischen Königshaus für Sardinien und Korsika verwendet. Die absolutistischen Könige Spaniens setzten unzählige Vizekönige ein, um die Kontrolle über weite Teile ihres riesigen Reiches, "in dem die Sonne niemals untergeht", sowohl in Europa als auch in Übersee zu sichern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un viceré è un funzionario reale che governa un Paese o una provincia nel nome e come rappresentante di un monarca. Il termine deriva dal prefisso latino vice-, che significa "al posto di" e dal francese roi, che significa re. La provincia o il territorio controllato si chiama vicereame. [PARAGRAPH:2]Il titolo venne originariamente usato dalla corona di Aragona, durante il 14° secolo, in riferimento a Sardegna e Corsica. I monarchi assoluti di Spagna usarono numerosi viceré per governare diverse parti del loro vasto impero, "su cui non tramonta mai il sole", sia in Europa che oltremare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un virrey es un delegado real que gobierna un país o una provincia en nombre de un monarca. El término deriva del latín "vice regis", que quiere decir "en nombre del rey". Su provincia o territorio se denomina "virreinato". [PARAGRAPH:2]El título lo utilizó originalmente la corona de Aragón durante el siglo XIV para aludir a Córcega y Cerdeña. Los reyes absolutistas españoles emplearon numerosos virreyes para gestionar su vasto imperio, tanto europeo como de ultramar, "en el que nunca se ponía el sol".

TEXT.French: Repeuplement
TEXT.Italian: Risistemazione
TEXT.Spanish: Reasentamiento

TEXT.English: [TAB]"Resettlement" literally means the transportation of a group of people to a new settlement and the populating of a new area. Although migration has featured throughout human history and prehistory, the word settler (synonymous with terms like pioneers and colonists) is often used in relation to modern or early modern history. [PARAGRAPH:2]The reason for emigration of settlers varies, but often includes one or more factors such as: personal economic hardship; social, cultural, ethnic, or religious persecution; political oppression; or policies aimed at encouraging foreign settlement.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Repeuplement" signifie littéralement amener un groupe de personnes dans une nouvelle implantation pour peupler une zone. Bien que la migration soit une constante de la préhistoire et de l'histoire de l'humanité, le mot colon (synonyme de pionnier) est souvent utilisé en relation avec l'histoire moderne ou contemporaine. [PARAGRAPH:2]Les raisons qui poussent à émigrer sont nombreuses, mais on retrouve souvent les difficultés économiques personnelles, les persécutions sociales, ethniques ou religieuses, l'oppression politique, ou des politiques encourageant la colonisation.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff "Umsiedlung" beschreibt den Umzug einer Gruppe von Menschen in ein neues Siedlungsgebiet bzw. die Bevölkerung neuer Gebiete. Während es derartige "Völkerwanderungen" in der gesamten Menschheitsgeschichte gegeben hat, wird der davon abgeleitete Begriff "Siedler" (Synonym für Pionier und Kolonist) häufig in Bezug auf die moderne bzw. frühmoderne Geschichte verwendet. [PARAGRAPH:2]Es gibt unterschiedliche Gründe für die Ab- bzw. Auswanderung von Siedlern, meist spielen dabei jedoch folgende Faktoren eine Rolle: persönliches bzw. wirtschaftliches Elend, soziale, kulturelle, ethnische oder religiöse Verfolgung, politische Unterdrückung oder die politische Förderung fremder Siedlungen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]"Risistemazione" sta a indicare il trasporto di un gruppo di persone in un nuovo insediamento e il popolamento di una nuova zona. Anche se le migrazioni hanno avuto luogo in tutta la storia e preistoria umana, la parola colonizzatore (o anche pioniere o colono) è spesso utilizzata in relazione alla storia moderna. [PARAGRAPH:2]Le ragioni per l'emigrazione dei coloni sono diverse, ma spesso includono uno o più fattori come: forti problemi economici; persecuzione sociale, culturale, etnica o religiosa; oppressione politica, oppure politiche che incoraggiano l'insediamento all'estero.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El "reasentamiento" consiste en el traslado de un grupo de personas a un nuevo enclave para poblar una nueva zona. Aunque la migración ha existido en toda la historia, e incluso en la prehistoria, el término colono, en ocasiones sinónimo de pionero, se suele utilizar en contextos de la historia moderna o contemporánea. [PARAGRAPH:2]Los motivos de la migración colonial son variados, pero a menudo incluyen dos o más factores, como penurias económicas, persecución social, cultural, étnica o religiosa, opresión política o políticas potenciadoras de la emigración o la inmigración.

TEXT.French: Occupation
TEXT.Italian: Occupazione
TEXT.Spanish: Ocupación

TEXT.English: [TAB]Belligerent military occupation occurs when one nation's military occupies all or part of the territory of another nation or recognized belligerent. [PARAGRAPH:2]In most wars some territory of the losing side is placed under the authority of the hostile army. Most military occupations end with the cessation of hostilities. In some cases the occupied territory is returned and in others the land remains under the control of the occupying power but usually not as militarily occupied territory. The latter was the case of Germany after WWII, which ended up being split into two different nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'occupation militaire désigne la présence d'une armée étrangère sur tout ou partie du territoire d'une autre nation ou d'un belligérant reconnu. [PARAGRAPH:2]Dans la plupart des guerres, certains territoires du pays vaincu sont placés sous l'autorité d'une armée ennemie. La plupart des occupations militaires se terminent avec la cessation des hostilités. Dans certains cas, le territoire occupé est rendu et dans d'autres, il reste sous le contrôle de la puissance occupante, mais plus en tant que territoire occupé militairement. La dernière occupation fut celle de l'Allemagne après la Seconde Guerre mondiale, qui se termina par sa division en deux pays distincts.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine kriegerische militärische Besatzung tritt dann ein, wenn die militärischen Streitkräfte einer Nation das Territorium einer anderen Nation oder eines Kriegsgegners vollständig oder teilweise besetzen. [PARAGRAPH:2]In den meisten Kriegen wurde ein Teil des Territoriums der Verliererseite der Befehlsgewalt der feindlichen Militärs unterstellt. Dabei beendeten die militärischen Besatzungen in der Regel gleichzeitig auch die Feindseligkeiten zwischen den Kriegsparteien. In manchen Fällen wurde das Besatzungsgebiet später wieder zurückgegeben, in anderen verblieb es in der Hand der Besatzungsmacht, normalerweise aber nicht mehr als militärisch besetztes Territorium. Letzteres ereignete sich nach dem 2. Weltkrieg in Deutschland und endete damit, dass Deutschland bis zur Wiedervereinigung im Jahr 1990 in zwei verschiedene Staaten aufgeteilt war.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'occupazione militare si ha quando l'esercito di una nazione occupa tutto o parte del territorio di un'altra nazione o fazione ostile. [PARAGRAPH:2]In molte guerre parte del territorio della fazione perdente viene posto sotto l'autorità dell'esercito ostile. La maggior parte delle occupazioni militari terminano con la cessazione delle ostilità. In alcuni casi il territorio occupato viene restituito, mentre in altri rimane sotto il controllo della potenza occupante, anche se solitamente non come territorio occupato militarmente. Questo fu il caso della Germania dopo la Seconda Guerra Mondiale, che finì con l'essere divisa in due diverse nazioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La ocupación militar se produce cuando un ejército beligerante de una nación ocupa todo o parte del territorio de otra nación. [PARAGRAPH:2]En muchas guerras, parte del territorio del bando derrotado es sometido a la autoridad del ejército hostil. La mayor parte de las ocupaciones militares finalizan con el cese de las hostilidades. En algunos casos, el territorio ocupado es devuelto, pero en otros la zona permanece bajo control de la potencia enemiga, aunque ya no como territorio ocupado militarmente. El último fue el caso de Alemania tras la II Guerra Mundial, que acabó siendo divida entre dos naciones diferentes.
